Trans. 29.8.94. To proof + bot. names.
Melbourne bot Garden,
Allow me to ask you, dear Prof de Candolle, whether you can spare me a small fragment of Ozothanmus adnatus from your illustrious fathers collection.

Mr Bentham refers O. adnatus to my O. retusus, and Dr Sonder (Linnaea 1852, 511) to my Ozothamnus decurrens (transact. phil. Inst. Vict. III, 59) — The impression left on my mind from reading the diagnosis, is this, that O. adnatus is a state of O. di[...]folius. These doubts can only be dispelled by the analysis of an original specimen.
Trusting that in the progress of your great labors you enjoy health & happiness, and offering you to the new decennium my best gratulation I remain your regardful
